DataElement.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Surgical Pathology Specimen Total Core Length Float
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Sum of all lengths of individual prostate needle biopsy cores, where length is the longest dimension of the core.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Gland Surgical Pathology Specimen Total Length
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The linear extent in space from one end to the other.  Often used synonymously with distance.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Prostate Gland Surgical Pathology Specimen
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system.  It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra.  The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.:A field of anatomical pathology in which living tissue is surgically removed for the purpose of diagnosis and treatment.:A sample or part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle, for microscopic examination.

The walnut shaped accessory sex gland of the male reproductive system. It is located in the pelvis just below the bladder, surrounding the prostatic part of the urethra. The prostate gland secretes a fluid which is part of the semen.
A field of anatomical pathology in which tissue or cells removed from a living organism are macroscopically and microscopically reviewed for the purpose of disease diagnosis.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:The linear extent in space from one end to the other.  Often used synonymously with distance.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
